text: Gordon Leavitt Shaw Hart (December 23, 1924 – September 28, 2010) was a Canadian politician and judge. He represented the electoral district of Halifax County Dartmouth in the Nova Scotia House of Assembly from 1960 to 1963, and Dartmouth North from 1967 to 1968. He was a member of the Nova Scotia Liberal Party. Born in 1924 at Halifax, Nova Scotia, Hart was a graduate of the University of King's College and Dalhousie University. A lawyer by career, he served as an alderman in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia from 1956 to 1960. Hart entered provincial politics in the 1960 election, winning the Halifax County Dartmouth riding by 605 votes. He was defeated by Irvin William Akerley when he ran for re-election in 1963. Hart returned to politics in the 1967 election, winning the new Dartmouth North riding. He resigned on September 30, 1968, when he was appointed to the Trial Division of the Supreme Court of Nova Scotia. In 1978, he was elevated to the Appeals Division, where he served until his retirement in 2000. He died in Dartmouth on September 28, 2010. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Judges in Nova Scotia Category:Nova Scotia Liberal Party MLAs Category:Dalhousie University alumni Category:University of King's College alumni Category:People from Dartmouth, Nova Scotia Category:People from Halifax, Nova Scotia
